text: The city of Ottawa, Canada held municipal elections on January 6, 1919 to elect members of the 1919 Ottawa City Council. The election saw a woman elected in the city for the first time, with Marion McDougall (wife of the late John Lorn McDougall) being elected as a public school trustee in Dalhousie Ward. ==Mayor of Ottawa== Fisher won seven of the city's nine wards, while Parent won the city's two francophone wards, By and Ottawa. {| class="wikitable" |- style="background-color:#E9E9E9" ! style="width: 200px"|Candidate ! style="width: 50px"|Votes ! style="width: 40px"|% |- |Harold Fisher || 7,624 || 62.16 |- |Rufus H.
